chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Catherine Loraine Buford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid directly to the Clerk of Court, 811 Harding Street, Waupaca WI  54981.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Defendant shall not discontinue mental health services unless recommended by provider and approved by Agent.
85 days credit, if probation is revoked.

records.addlTxt:
Bond Terminated Slip
c: WC Jail

10:42 AM 
Defendant Catherine Loraine Buford in court.  
Attorney Thomas W. Johnson in court for Catherine Loraine Buford.  
Attorney Nicholas William Bolz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
PQ Filed with the Court 
State has complied with victim witness notifications. 
Defendant questioned by Court and advised of rights. 
Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. 
Court accepts plea and finds guilty of count 1. Court orders counts 2-3 dismissed and read in. 
Joint sentence recommendations by Counsel 
Statements by Court
Court orders: Sentence withheld, 30 months of probations, conditions to include:
- Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
-Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
-Not discontinue mental health services unless recommended by provider and approved by agent. 
-Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant to pay court costs to the COC within 60 days.  JOC to reflect 85 days of pre-sentence credit.
Defendant advised of appeal rights and firearm an voting restrictions.
Bail/bond hearing on September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
